result.execSummary:
The defendant Courtney Alan Woods was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If Probation is revoked and sent to jail or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.

No contact directly or indirectly with any known drug dealers or residences known for drug use.
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription.

Counseling/assessments/treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA assessment.
Provide DNA sample.

2:31 PM Defendant Courtney Alan Woods in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey A Jaeger in court for Courtney Alan Woods.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State puts global resolution on the record.
Deft pleads no contest to charges as stated on the record - Court finds Deft Guilty. 
All remaining charges Dismissed and Read in.
State makes sentencing argument.
Atty Jaeger makes sentencing argument - 87 days credit on case #22CF401.
Atty Derksen makes sentencing argument.
Deft makes statement to Court.

11:41 AM Defendant Courtney Alan Woods in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey A Jaeger in court for Courtney Alan Woods.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Jaeger has a global offer form the State covering 4 other cases where he is represented by Atty Derksen. 
Atty Jaeger notes all other cases have been sent to Branch 2, but not in Court until October 18th for scheduling conference. Notes this is the only case Deft has a cash bail on and requests Court to modify bail.
Requesting a quick turn around date for sentencing on all cases.
Court schedules plea/sentencing. 
Atty Jaeger to contact Atty Derksen to let him know of new date/time.
Court not inclined to modify bond at this time.
Jury Trials to remain on the calendar until pleas are entered.

Information efiled/reading waived, Not guilty plea entered all Counts.
